comments:
I just installed eclipse3.1M6 on my box (Win Server 2003). I imported a few 
projects in my workscape. I then tried to edit some files in the imported 
projects. Am getting the popup error saying an SWT error occured and I need to 
exit the workbench (The error log is attached below). This error is not random 
and happens everytime I try to edit.


!SESSION 2005-04-21 12:08:22.984 -----------------------------------------------

This appears to have nothing to do with GEF.  If you do have a resource leak, 
you need to provide complete steps to reproduce, such as which plug-ins you 
have installed, etc.

Please provide more info:

- does this happen on a fresh install?
- did you install additional plug-ins or just Eclipse SDK?
- does it also happen if you create new files and edit them or is it just with
the imported files
- in what kind of editor (Text, Java, ...) do you open the file?

Amit, are you using the underline style. If so, this is the source of trouble 
and has been fixed by the SWT team recently.

(In reply to comment #2)
> Please provide more info:
> - does this happen on a fresh install?
I got those errors on a fresh install.

> - did you install additional plug-ins or just Eclipse SDK?
No additional plugins. Just Eclipse SDK.

> - does it also happen if you create new files and edit them or is it just with
> the imported files
Happens with both.

> - in what kind of editor (Text, Java, ...) do you open the file?
Java editor

As an aside, I rebooted my box and am not getting these errors now. Still
it would be good to know the cause of the problem.

Thanks,
Amit
Some other app might have used/leaked all the handles.
